''[[Rifts (role-playing game)|Rifts]]'' | spouse = Maryann Donald (1985â2004) | children = | influences = | influenced = | signature = | website = }} '''Kevin Siembieda''' (born April 2, 1956) is an [[United States|American]] [[artist]], [[writer]], [[Game designer|designer]], and [[Publishing|publisher]] of [[role-playing game]]s, and the co-founder and [[President#Non-governmental presidents|president]] of [[Palladium Books]].{{cite web | url = http://www.palladiumbooks.com/index.php/about-palladium/personalities/in-house-staff#Kevin | title = Palladium Books Personalities: In-House Staff | publisher = [[Palladium Books]] | location = [[Westland, Michigan|Westland, MI]] | accessdate = August 8, 2011}} Some of the role-playing games that Siembieda has created include ''[[Palladium Fantasy Role-Playing Game]]'' (1983), ''[[Heroes Unlimited]]'' (1984), ''[[Robotech (role-playing game)|Robotech]]'' (1986), and ''[[Rifts (role-playing game)|Rifts]]'' (1990).{{cite web | url = http://www.rpgblog2.com/2009/07/mega-interview-with-kevin-siembieda.html | title = Mega-Interview with Kevin Siembieda | first = Z. | last = Houghton | date = July 13, 2009 | work = RPG Blog II | publisher = [[Google]] / [[Blogger (service)|Blogger]] | location = [[Mountain View, California|Mountain View, CA]] | accessdate = January 15, 2010}} Siembieda is also an artist, best known for occasionally illustrating Palladium Books' products. Prior to 1973, he started the now-defunct Megaton Publications in [[Detroit|Detroit, Michigan]] with Alex Marciniszyn. Together they published a [[science fiction]] [[fanzine]] called ''Nightspawn'' in 1973 and a digest-style title called ''A+Plus Comics'' in 1977. Siembieda also contributed art and cartography to several early [[Judges Guild]] products for the ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'', ''[[RuneQuest]]'', and ''[[Traveller (role-playing game)|Traveller]]'' lines.{{cite web | url = http://www.acaeum.com/jg/index.html | title = Judges Guild Booty List | work = The Acaeum | publisher = HostForWeb | location = [[Chicago|Chicago, IL]] | accessdate = February 15, 2011}} == Early illustration credits == === Judges Guild === ==== Adventure modules ==== ===== ''Dungeons & Dragons'' ===== [[File:Verbosh.jpg|thumb|Front cover of ''Dungeons & Dragons'' adventure module ''Verbosh'' (Nevins & Faust 1979, 2nd printing).]] *{{cite book | first1 = Paul | last1 = Nevins | first2 = Bill | last2 = Faust | series = ''[[Editions of Dungeons & Dragons#Dungeons & Dragons|Dungeons & Dragons]]'' (''D&D'') | title = Verbosh | year = 1979 | month = October | publisher = [[Judges Guild]] | location = [[Decatur, Illinois|Decatur, IL]] | id = [JG 108] | lastauthoramp = & }} - Front cover, interior art; maps (with B.
